title: Process & Impact Review: Engaging With Scottish Local Authorities Scheme
abstractText: The project consists of an independent Process and Impact Review of the Engaging Scottish Local Authorities Scheme. The Process and Impact Review took place alongside ESLA and was concerned with reviewing how the projects have enhanced engagement between universities and local authorities in Scotland, their outputs and the short term impact of those projects. In consultation with the Funding Partners, the Coordinating team and participating universities and local authorities, the Review draws together evidence from the projects' processes, outputs and short term impacts. The emphasis is on learning to inform future activities.
findingsText: For this award see the entry for RES 809 19 0022A, this award transferred with me when I moved from Nottingham Trent to Northumbria University see entry for 0022A Education
